q: A click-and-mortar retailer struggles to keep prices competitive both online and in-store. Which issue is this?
A manufacturer allows customers to design and order laptops online. Which model is this?
A retailer wants to understand customer preferences and personalize product recommendations online. Which advantage applies?
A customer orders groceries online and requests delivery within an hour. Which service is this?
A consumer visits an online mall that redirects them to a vendor's website to complete the purchase. Which type of mall is this?
A small company wants to compete with large retailers by selling online. Which e-tailing benefit helps them most?
A gamer buys virtual items in an online world that can be used in real-world purchases. Which concept applies?
A bank offers customers the ability to pay bills and transfer funds online. Which term describes this?
A company sells both through physical stores and an online website. Which business model is this?
A consumer uses a website that compares prices across multiple online stores. Which tool is being used?
Which of the following is an example of social shopping?
What does "pure-play e-tailer" mean?
opts: Retailer with both online and offline stores

q: Which service allows customers to configure and order directly from manufacturers?
Which B2C model offers heavily discounted products for a short time?
What is "disintermediation" in e-commerce?
Location-based e-commerce uses which technology?
Which business model combines physical stores and online presence?
Which tool helps consumers compare prices across multiple sites?
Which term refers to sellers who conduct retail business online?
A group of friends collaborates online to buy a wedding gift. Which model applies?
A traveler uses an app to find last-minute flight deals and book tickets online. Which service is this?
A customer prefers buying software online because it is in a digitized format. Which product characteristic supports this?
A company adds an escrow service to ensure safe transactions between buyers and sellers. Which concept applies?
Which of the following is NOT a benefit of online travel services?
Which of the following is an example of a multichannel business model?
Which type of online mall provides a directory and transfers users to vendor sites?
Which delivery option requires immediate fulfillment after order?
What is electronic retailing commonly called?
Which of the following is a major issue in B2C e-commerce?
Which term refers to adding new intermediaries in online transactions?
customer receives ads on their phone for nearby restaurants while walking downtown. Which technology is used?
A retailer offers a 70% discount for 24 hours on selected items. Which B2C model is being used?
A retailer removes wholesalers and sells directly to customers online. What is this called?
Which term refers to online banking?
A company offers discounted membership for customers to access exclusive deals online for a limited time. Which model is this?
Which factor influences online vs offline retail competition?
Which of these goods is most likely to sell online?
A consumer uses Facebook reviews and friends' ratings before buying a product online. Which concept is this?
A customer wants to buy a rare collectible item that is not available in local stores. Which e-tailing advantage applies?
Which of the following is NOT an advantage of e-tailing for customers?
opts: Pay less than in traditional stores
